text: {{Infobox writer | name = James Tate | image =James-tate-and-gordon-cairnie-by-elsa-dorfman.jpg | imagesize = | alt = | caption =Tate (left) at the Grolier Poetry Book Shop in 1965 with the owner, Gordon Cairnie | pseudonym = | birth_name = James Vincent Tate | birth_date = | birth_place = Kansas City, Missouri, USA | death_date = | death_place = Amherst, Massachusetts, USA | resting_place = | occupation = Poet, professor of English at the University of Massachusetts Amherst | language = | nationality = | ethnicity = | citizenship = | education = | alma_mater = | period = | genre = | subject = | movement = | notableworks =Worshipful Company of Fletchers | spouse = | partner = | children = | relatives = | awards = | signature = | signature_alt = | website = }} James Vincent Tate (December 8, 1943 â€“ July 8, 2015) was an American poet whose work earned him the Pulitzer Prize and the National Book Award. He was a professor of English at the University of Massachusetts AmherstJames Tate elected to American Academy of Arts and Letters , a April 29, 2004 article from University of Massachusetts Amherst and a member of the American Academy of Arts and Letters. == Related pages == *List of poets from North America ==References== Category:Pulitzer Prize winners Category:1943 births Category:2015 deaths Category:American poets Category:Writers from Kansas City, Missouri
